result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew S Schulz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge 
Incarceration and IS Eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
Sentence credit of 52 days were granted if imposed.
02/18/20 UNPON REQUEST BY DEFENDANT AND WITH NO OBJECTION BY THE STATE, THE COURT GRANTS ADDITIONAL CREDIT OF 84 DAYS.

miscConds.notes: Restitution to victim for $26,890.00 and to Eve's Jewelry $250.00 to be paid as a condition of probation. To be paid before fines and fees.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Sign any releases for agent.

No Contact with any victims or residence listed in the criminal complaint or with the family members. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: As a condition of probation, non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. Commencing forthwith. Court Denies request from Jail to revoke Huber privileges.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Andrew S Schulz in court, in custody, with Attorney Joseph Edward Schubert.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Kathrynann M. makes statements.  John M. makes statements.   Attorney Schubert makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  NOTE:  Court denies request from the jail to revoke Defendant's huber privileges.   Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

12 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 52 days)
  -  7 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  5 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

TERM OF PROBATION:  7 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: victim or residence listed in criminal complaint or with the family members
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

RESTITUTION:  $26,890.00 to victim (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)
                          $     250.00 to Eve's Jewelry (to be paid as a condition of probation - restitution to be paid before costs or fines)

COSTS:  $278.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

CONDITION TIME:   3 MONTHS, Non-working hours with standard release conditions to commence forthwith (Defendant already in custody)  *Court denies request from jail to revoke huber privileges.* 

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
